newsitem.title: USA: British Airways may pare NY/London flights.
newsitem.headline: British Airways may pare NY/London flights.

text.p: British Airways said that, if a pending three-day London cabin crew strike begins on Wednesday, it will cut to three from four its daily Boeing 747 flights from New York's John F. Kennedy Airport to London.
Speaking to Reuters in New York, an airline official added that BA's daily Boeing 777 flight to and from London would be canceled for the duration of the strike.
However, the company's two daily Concorde flights between London and JFK will fly as scheduled.

The carrier, which services JFK from Heathrow with two Concorde flights, one Boeing 777 and four B747s daily, said it will cut back to three B747 flights on Wednesday and two each on Thursday and Friday.
The daily Boeing 747 flight to Newark from London and back, likewise will be cancelled as of Wednesday. - Reuters Air Cargo Service Tel+ 44 171 542 7706 Fax +5017 - www.racs.com
